POO.content: duplicity in a ceremony, being-double, “hollows itself out in an infinite abyss:” one is neither friendly nor polite if one obeys the rules
should not be polite or friendly out of duty (aus Pflicht), proposition ventured against Kant
nonresponse as form of politeness, responsible form of vigilant exercise of responsibility > one cannot or one ought not to fail to respond (ought/can strangely co-implicated, perhaps)
complaint (of exhaustion) & accusation lodged against matrix of discourse of veil
complain about myself to myself: immodesty, impudence > but veil makes modest
complaint: give up all modesty, most elementary politeness

LI.content: “Politeness and politics” could have been subtitle of Limited Inc
Derrida worked to make legible (philosophical, political, ethical) axiomatics hidden under code of academic discourse > brutality of both politeness & impoliteness

WOG.content: to be polite and not speak about yourself could be excuse for haughty detachment
